page.title: 13 LIFF HOSPITAL
page.content: Liff hospital is situated to the East of Liff.It is a large hospital for the mentally infirm and was formerly known as West Green.It now incorporates an old dwelling called Gowrie House bought for the use of old patients. Next to the house is a small tennis court surrounded by large grassy areas intermingled with flowers and shrubs. To the South of the hospital there are the Gardens of Gray.These gardens were used to produce food for the Earl of Murray and his family who lived in the Gray House.For more information refer to page 12. To the East of Liff Hospital are two small cottages normally called Whitelawston cottages which are surrounded by fields belonging to Stoneygroves Farm which is to the North West.
